questions.title: What is the difference between an array and a list

options.a: Lists need to first be imported, or declared, from other libraries (i.e. numpy).
options.b: Lists consume more memory as they are allocated a few extra elements to allow for quicker appending of items.
options.c: Arrays can also be re-sized quickly in a time-efficient manner. This is because Python initializes some extra elements in the array at initialization.
options.d: Lists can only store homogenous data. They have values with uniform data types.
